Math_Problem: Find all positive integers $a,b$ for which $a^4+4b^4$ is a prime number. Instead of finding all positive integer pairs that make the given expression prime, simply find $m$, the prime number equal to that expression. Manya has a stack of $85=1+4+16+64$ blocks comprised of 4 layers (the $k$ th layer from the top has $4^{k-1}$ blocks). Each block rests on 4 smaller blocks, each with dimensions half those of the larger block. Laura removes blocks one at a time from this stack, removing only blocks that currently have no blocks on top of them. Find the number of ways Laura can remove precisely $m$ blocks from Manya's stack (the order in which they are removed matters).

Connecting_Sentence.A3724: Instead of finding all positive integer pairs that make the given expression prime, simply find $m$, the prime number equal to that expression.

Synthesised_By.A3724: Find all positive integers $a,b$ for which $a^4+4b^4$ is a prime number. Instead of finding all positive integer pairs that make the given expression prime, simply find $m$, the prime number equal to that expression.

Synthesised_By.A1193: Manya has a stack of $85=1+4+16+64$ blocks comprised of 4 layers (the $k$ th layer from the top has $4^{k-1}$ blocks). Each block rests on 4 smaller blocks, each with dimensions half those of the larger block. Laura removes blocks one at a time from this stack, removing only blocks that currently have no blocks on top of them. Find the number of ways Laura can remove precisely 5 blocks from Manya's stack (the order in which they are removed matters).

Original_Problem.A3724: Find all positive integers $a,b$ for which $a^4+4b^4$ is a prime number.

Original_Problem.A1193: Manya has a stack of $85=1+4+16+64$ blocks comprised of 4 layers (the $k$ th layer from the top has $4^{k-1}$ blocks). Each block rests on 4 smaller blocks, each with dimensions half those of the larger block. Laura removes blocks one at a time from this stack, removing only blocks that currently have no blocks on top of them. Find the number of ways Laura can remove precisely 5 blocks from Manya's stack (the order in which they are removed matters).

A1193: Mathematics -> Applied Mathematics -> Statistics -> Probability -> Counting Methods -> Combinations

Claims.expr: find all positive integers a, b such that a^4 + 4b^4 is prime
a^2 + 2ab + 2b^2 = 1 has no positive integer solutions
the only possibility is a^2 - 2ab + 2b^2 = 1 and a^2 + 2ab + 2b^2 prime
let x = a - b, y = b, then x^2 + y^2 = 1 with y >=1 integer, x integer
the only solution is x=0, y=1
W = number of ways to remove exactly 5 blocks in sequence, only exposed blocks
4 layers; layer k from top has 4^{k-1} blocks, k=1 to 4
Each block rests on 4 smaller blocks in next layer
Removals only of exposed blocks (no blocks on top)
Removing non-bottom block exposes 4 new blocks
Removing bottom (layer 4) block exposes 0 new blocks
Net change for non-bottom removal: +3 exposed blocks
In infinite model, exposed after m removals: 1 + 3m
Overcount occurs when 4th removal is layer 4 block and 5th is phantom
Such sequences follow single path: layer1, layer2, layer3, layer4
W = number of ways to remove exactly (b=1} + 0) blocks in sequence, only exposed blocks
